conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_A and I’m formally applying. School_B is my first-choice school because I strongly value the academic environment and want to contribute actively to the school community. If admitted, I will commit fully and make School_B my top priority. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. However, School_B’s priority ranking places me last, and several students (E, B, C, D) are likely to apply there early since it is also high on their lists. Still, applying now is my best chance to secure my first choice before they fill their single seat. I will send a concise, motivated application emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your thoughtful application and for sharing your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications received this round and our priority considerations, we’re unable to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and true priority order E > B > C > D > A. In this round, applicants are C, D, and A. Among them, C is highest on my list, then D, then A. Since accepting A now would fill my only seat and block a better available candidate (C or D), I should reject A. Also, Student_E and Student_B (ranked above all three) may apply later, so keeping flexibility is valuable.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_D. School_B is my first choice, and I’m very eager to enroll if admitted. I’m ready to commit and would be excited to contribute to the school community. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true preference is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me 4th, early application is still my best chance to secure my #1 before higher-priority students lock it up, and delaying only risks losing the seat with no upside.

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications received this round and considering our priority order and limited capacity, we’re unable to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your time and wish you the best in the remainder of the process.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Inbox includes Student_C and Student_D (and Student_A, previously rejected). My true priority is E > B > C > D > A, so among current applicants C outranks D. Also, Student_B (my #2) and Student_E (my #1) have not contacted me yet; Student_B prefers School_A first, Student_E prefers School_C first, so they may become available later if rejected elsewhere. To maximize chance of matching with a higher-priority student, I should not fill the seat with Student_D now. Therefore reject D while keeping capacity for C/B/E.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team. I’m Student_C, and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m very motivated to join and would be excited to commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. I have relatively strong priority there (School_B ranks me 3rd), giving me a realistic chance if higher-ranked students choose other schools. Applying now maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before seats fill.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We appreciate your strong motivation to join our community.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. [ACCEPT]

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Our true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round we received APPLY from A, D, and C. Among these, C is the highest on our priority list, so accepting C dominates accepting A or D. However, we must consider whether to hold out for higher-priority students E or B. Student_E does not rank us highly (puts School_B last), so is unlikely to apply here unless rejected elsewhere. Student_B ranks School_B second after School_A and may apply here if not accepted by School_A; but School_A’s top priorities are E then D then A then B, so B is not very likely to be accepted there if E/D/A apply. Still, B might come to us in a later round. Yet we are not allowed to “hold” offers; we must accept/reject now. Given we already have a solid applicant (C) who ranks us first, and the chance of getting B is uncertain, the safe strategy to maximize expected outcome within quota is to accept C now rather than risk ending unmatched or matched with lower-ranked D/A later. Therefore accept Student_C.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E and I’m very interested in joining School_A. I value a rigorous academic environment and I’m ready to commit and contribute strongly to the school community. If admitted, I will accept and enroll. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_C, but School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D). Since each school has capacity 1 and Student_B ranks School_C 3rd (after A, B) while Student_C ranks School_C 2nd and Student_D ranks School_C 2nd, School_C is likely to receive applicants with higher priority than me. By contrast, School_A ranks me 1st overall, and School_A is my 3rd choice. Applying to School_A in round 1 gives me a very high chance to lock in a strong match immediately before competition intensifies, rather than risking rejection at School_C and losing the chance to secure School_A if it fills. Therefore I will apply to School_A now.

Accepting Student_E immediately secures our top choice and avoids the risk of losing them to another school in subsequent rounds. Matching now is optimal for our objective.

Student_E is also our top true-priority candidate, so even if we had flexibility, we would keep that match. Under the rules, with remaining quota = 0, we must reject any new [APPLY] messages. Therefore, we must reject Student_B's application.
